msItem.title: Hilkhot sheḥitah u-vediḳah הלכות שחיטה ובדיקה
[Shiv῾im ṭerefot she-minah ha-Rambam] [שבעים טריפות שמנה הרמב"ם]

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive scripts of the 18th century. Yehudah Ḥayim: perhaps the copyist of the part of the manuscript: inscribed in the prefixed certificates, folios 1r-6r.

binding.p: Post-1600. Contemporary leather binding. Gold tooled. Spine title: 'Jacob Weil. Hilkhoth Shechitah. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,147.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 255: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153: inscribed, folio [74v].
